body:
On Nov 12, 2006, at 12:04 AM, Gregory J. Ward wrote:


I think most Radiance users know how to use such an option with
caution.  If anything, it's a nice starting point, a way to see what
you're dealing with in a given scene.  I don't see how it's much
different from defaulting to '-s 1000'; certainly there is potential
there for gross misrepresentation of the luminous environment as well?
